intro: Leptochilus fendleri, commonly known as the Mexican stonecrop, is a member of the Crassulaceae family. It is a succulent perennial that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant features fleshy, thick leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white or pale pink during the spring or early summer. Leptochilus fendleri is adapted to survive in dry conditions, storing water in its leaves and stems.
